column2: NEW YORK PERMIT PRACTICE TEST
column4: New York

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. This sign means:
column4: Divided highway ends.
column8: Drivers will soon be on a roadway with two-way traffic.

column2: 2. You go with a group of friends to a social event, and you plan to have a few drinks. You should:
column4: avoid alternating between drinks with alcohol and drinks without any alcohol.
column6: stop drinking several minutes before you intend to leave.
column8: arrange to ride home with a friend who does not drink.
column10: make alcohol the focus of the event.

column2: 3. HOV lanes:
column4: are reserved for law enforcement vehicles.
column6: assure the most important people get to their destination faster.
column8: promote the most efficient use of limited street and highway capacity.
column10: will soon be replaced by VIP lanes.

column2: 4. Which of the following contains enough alcohol to increase BAC by about .02 percent?
column4: 20 oz. can of beer (5% alcohol)
column8: 3 oz. liquor (80 proof)

column2: 5. If you are involved in a crash and must move an injured person, you should:
column4: pull the victim feet first away from the danger.
column6: if there are wires down, go near them.
column8: keep the back and neck as straight as possible.

column2: 6. Are three motorcyclists allowed to ride side-by-side in a single lane?
column4: Yes, but they must have at least 3 years experience driving motorcycles.
column6: Yes, up to three motorcyclists are allowed to ride side-by-side in a single lane.
column8: No, motorcyclists are never allowed to ride side-by-side in a single lane.
column10: No. Two motorcyclists are allowed to ride side-by-side in a single lane, but not three.

column2: 7. If you remain in the back blind spot of a large vehicle:
column4: you increase the chance of a crash.
column8: the large vehicle will take much longer to stop.

column2: 8. You face a green light, but traffic on the other side of the intersection does not allow you to travel all the way through the intersection. What must you do?
column4: Wait until traffic ahead clears, so you do not block the intersection.
column8: Enter the intersection and wait until traffic ahead clears.
column10: Wait for the next green light.

column2: 9. Left turns on a red light are allowed:
column4: Never.
column8: from a one-way street into a one-way street.
column10: at intersections, after stopping, if the way is clear.

column2: 10. In heavy rain, tires can begin to ride on the water that is on top of the road pavement. This is called:
column4: pavement-planing.
column8: hydroplaning.

column2: 11. New York State occupant restraint law:
column4: is meant to restrain the use of seat belts.
column6: also applies to visitors from outside New York State.
column8: applies to New York State residents only.
column10: applies to passengers 16 years or older.

column2: 12. This road sign indicates that:
column4: vehicles cannot go straight ahead. Cars must turn either to the right or left.
column6: a lane is reserved for certain purposes or certain vehicles.
column8: buses and car pools may not travel in the restricted lane.

column2: 13. Before a school bus stops to load passengers, the driver will usually flash:
column4: red lights.
column8: red warning lights.

column2: 14. Drivers often fail to see a motorcycle headed toward them. Why?
column4: It is difficult to judge a motorcycle's speed.
column8: It is  hard to judge how far away a motorcycle is.

column2: 15. Which of the following is a defensive driving skill/technique?
column4: Maintain the correct speed.
column6: Do not drive if you are very weary.
column8: Keep your vehicle in good condition.

column2: 16. If you are in a crash you must:
column4: exchange information with the other drivers involved.
column6: show your insurance identification card if requested.
column8: if any person is injured, make sure the ambulance have been called.

column2: 17. This sign tells drivers that:
column4: U-turns are not allowed.
column6: they must make a left turn at the intersection.
column8: they must not make a right turn.

column2: 18. This sign means:
column4: Warning: sharp left turn ahead.
column8: You must make a U-turn.

column2: 19. Double solid lines on the roadway mean:
column4: you can not go across the lines except to turn left to enter or leave the highway.
column8: you cannot change lanes.

column2: 20. When you pass another vehicle, before you return to the right lane, you must:
column4: make sure you can see the front bumper of the vehicle you passed.
column6: look at your interior rear-view mirror.
column8: signal.
